title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2012 local authority codes St Albans Welwyn Hatfield changed. Source: ONS

title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2013 local authority codes Northumberland, East Hertfordshire, Stevenage Gateshead changed. Source: ONS

title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2018 local authority district Shepway renamed Folkestone Hyde.

title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2019, Suffolk Bournemouth, Poole Dorset…. pictorial representation see wikipedia entry

title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2020, County Buckinghamshire lower tier districts became one unitary authority. pictorial representation see wikipedia entry

title: LA Boundary Changes
text: April 2021, two-tier county Northamptonshire, containing districts Corby, East Northamptonshire, Kettering, Wellingborough, Daventry, Northampton South Northamptonshire abolished replaced two new unitary authorities - North West Northamptonshire. pictorial representation see wikipedia entry

what: Drawing a choropleth map with a simple feature
title: Using `ukgeog` to draw choropleth maps
text: first merge mid-2019 population density estimates ONS, something plot: Now plot choropleth maps base R easier use packages:
code: population <- data.frame(                 country = c("England", "Wales", "Scotland", "Northern Ireland"),                 `Population Density` = as.numeric(c("432", "152", "70", "137")),                 check.names = FALSE               )  sf <- dplyr::left_join(sf, population, by = "country")

previous_headings: Drawing a choropleth map with a simple feature
title: Using `ukgeog` to draw choropleth maps
code: cols <- c("#EDF8E9", "#BAE4B3", "#74C476", "#31A354", "#006D2C") brks <- c(0, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500) col <- cols[findInterval(sf$`Population Density`, vec = brks)]  plot(sf$geometry, col = col) legend("bottomleft",         legend = levels(cut(sf$`Population Density`, brks)),         fill = cols,         title = "Population Density")

previous_headings: Drawing a choropleth map with a simple feature
title: Using `ukgeog` to draw choropleth maps

previous_headings: Drawing a choropleth map with a simple feature
title: Using `ukgeog` to draw choropleth maps
code: library(tmap) #> Warning: package 'tmap' was built under R version 4.1.3  qtm(sf, fill = "Population Density") +   tm_legend(legend.position = c("left", "top"))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hodge L (2022). ukgeog: Download Manipulate UK Geographies. https://l-hodge.github.io/ukgeog/, https://github.com/l-hodge/ukgeog.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ukgeog: Download and Manipulate UK Geographies},   author = {Louis Hodge},   year = {2022},   note = {https://l-hodge.github.io/ukgeog/, https://github.com/l-hodge/ukgeog}, }

title: Download and Manipulate UK Geographies
text: ukgeog simple package facilitate easy download official spatial data sets UK. includes wide range geospatial data, provided simple feature sf objects (like shapefiles better). Making easy make Choropleth Maps base R, well popular packages ggplot2 leaflet.

what: Functions to download UK boundaries from the ONS
title: Download and Manipulate UK Geographies
text: available_sf returns list available boundaries select_sf can used interactively select set boundaries download read_sf can used download boundaries following geographies using ‘geog’ ‘year’ arguments:

previous_headings: Functions to download UK boundaries from the ONS
title: Download and Manipulate UK Geographies
code: library(ukgeog)  # Read in simple feature data frame of the countries that make up the UK  sf <- read_sf("NAT")

title: Get UK boundary shapefiles — read_sf
text: read_sf downloads boundaries ONS Open Geography Portal.

title: Get UK boundary shapefiles — read_sf
code: read_sf(   geog,   year = 2021,   nations = c("E", "S", "W", "N"),   type = "BGC",   crs = 4326 )

title: Get UK boundary shapefiles — read_sf
text: geog Type boundaries Administrative Boundaries available: - Countries/Nations ("NAT") - Regions (England ) ("GOR") - Upper Tier Local Authorities ("UTLA") - Lower Tier Local Authorities ("LAD") Census Boundaries available: - Output Area ("OA") - Lower Super Output Area ("LSOA") - Middle Super Output Area ("MSOA") Electoral Boundaries available: - Westminster Parliamentary Constituencies ("WM") - European Union Parliamentary Constituencies ("EU") - Welsh Assembly Constituencies ("WAC") - Welsh Assembly Regions ("WAR") Eurostat NUTS Boundaries available: - NUTS Level 1 (NUTS1) - NUTS Level 2 (NUTS2) - NUTS Level 3 (NUTS3) year Year (use available_sf() see available years set boundaries) nations UK nations (c("E","W","S","N")) type Boundary clipping - "BFE": Full Resolution Extent Realm (Low Tide) - "BFC": Full Resolution Clipped (High Tide) - "BGC": Generalised (20m) Clipped (High Tide) - "BUC": Ultra Generalised (500m) Clipped (High Tide) crs Coordinate Reference System (ESPG). recommend use 4326 (World Geodetic System) potentially 27700 (UK OS British National Grid)

title: Get UK boundary shapefiles — read_sf
text: Output simple feature sf object containing relevant boundaries.

title: Get UK boundary shapefiles — read_sf
